author: Jeffrey Trinker
text:
There is a large food manufacturing plant in our ETJ that my city have been providing free fire service to for a number of years.  It has become too expensive for the city to continue providing those services free of charge.  We are looking at a number of options for continuing to provide this service, and I am hoping that some other cities have developed innovative ways to provide and fund these services.
The options I have so far include:
1)  An Emergency Service District
2)  A Fire Service Agreement
3)  Industrial District Agreement
4)  Special Purpose Annexation
I am in Texas, but I would like to hear of any ideas managers from other states (as well as Texas) might have.
Thanks in advance.
title: Fire service provision options
